SEARCH
Package it.unipd.dei.webapp.lupus.utils

Class PossibleGameActions

java.lang.Object
it.unipd.dei.webapp.lupus.utils.PossibleGameActions
public class PossibleGameActions extends Object
Utility class for managing possible game actions and generating action targets based on the game state.

This class provides methods to handle day and night phases of the game, generate action targets for players, validate game actions, and retrieve lists of action targets.

It interacts with the database to retrieve information about players, their roles, and the game state.

    • PossibleGameActions

      public PossibleGameActions(DataSource ds, int gameID) throws SQLException
      Constructs a new PossibleGameActions instance with the specified data source and game ID.
      Parameters:
      ds - The DataSource used to connect to the database.
      gameID - The ID of the game for which to generate possible actions.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurs.

  • Method Details

    • populateList

      public Message populateList()
      Populates the list of possible game actions based on the current game state.
      Returns:
      A Message object indicating the success or failure of populating the action list.

    • getListOfActions

      public List<ActionTarget> getListOfActions()
      Retrieves the list of action targets.
      Returns:
      The list of action targets.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If the actionTargets list is null.

    • isValidAction

      public boolean isValidAction(GameAction action, Boolean extra)
      Checks if the given action is valid for the current game phase.

      The action is considered valid if:

      • The specified role exists in the game.
      • The player performing the action has the specified role (for night phase).
      • The specified target is valid.
      Parameters:
      action - The game action to be validated.
      Returns:
      True if the action is valid, otherwise false.
